Senior Data Engineer, Data Enablement

Boston, MA, United States

Full Time Senior-level / Expert USD 116K - 146K
  • Website
  • LinkedIn
  • @draftkingslife 𝕏
  • Search

Dr

DraftKings Inc.

View all jobs at DraftKings Inc.

Apply now Apply later

Posted 1 week ago

We’re defining what it means to build and deliver the most extraordinary sports and entertainment experiences. Our global team is trailblazing new markets, developing cutting-edge products, and shaping the future of responsible gaming.

Here, “impossible” isn’t part of our vocabulary. You’ll face some of the toughest but most rewarding challenges of your career. They’re worth it. Channeling your inner grit will accelerate your growth, help us win as a team, and create unforgettable moments for our customers.

The Crown Is Yours

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will act as a creative contributor, leader, and mentor in our Data Engineering organization. In this role, you’ll leverage your experience and expertise to build data solutions to unlock insights into our data products and support critical business data quality and health reporting. You’ll work with business partners to understand their needs and incorporate detailed knowledge into how data is used, managed, and maintained. This will assist with addressing stakeholder questions and support data-driven initiatives.

What you’ll do as a Senior Data Engineer, Data Enablement

  • Design and support scripts, APIs, and solutions to integrate tools and data sources seamlessly.

  • Collaborate with IT and business teams to design and implement data quality rules, monitoring, and escalation processes.

  • Curate and implement enterprise data catalog policies, ensuring metadata accuracy and accessibility for users.

  • Support Data Privacy and Compliance with regulatory requirements (including, but not limited to, PII/PGI/CCPA/GDPR/PCI) and enhance governance frameworks through effective collaboration.

 

What you’ll bring   

  • Hands-on experience working with Data Streaming using Python.

  • Proven ability to analyze data dependencies and implement robust integration and governance solutions.

  • Background in the following tools and technologies: Snowflake, Databricks, Kafka, Terraform, PagerDuty, DataDog, Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket.

  • Expertise in Data Warehouses, Data Lakes, Data Modeling, Data Streaming, and Star Schema Design or Data Vault Design.

  • Experience with at least one cloud provider (preferably AWS).

  • Understanding of ETL Solutions.

  • Experience with NoSQL Databases (Mongo, DynamoDB, etc.).

  • Familiarity with visualization tools, such as Sigma is considered a plus.

Join Our Team

We’re a publicly traded (NASDAQ: DKNG) technology company headquartered in Boston. As a regulated gaming company, you may be required to obtain a gaming license issued by the appropriate state agency as a condition of employment. Don’t worry, we’ll guide you through the process if this is relevant to your role.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is 116,800.00 USD - 146,000.00 USD, plus bonus, equity, and benefits as applicable. Our ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The compensation information displayed on each job posting reflects the range for new hire pay rates for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range and how that was determined during the hiring process. It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.
Apply now Apply later
